Title: Senior Researcher, Product Experience (Growth)
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with over 260 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across various genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans anytime.

The Product Experience Research team is central in uncovering compelling ways to engage and entertain our global members. This Senior Research role supports Growth, which strives to better attract new members to Netflix and explore new monetization opportunities worldwide. Specifically, this role will focus on how Netflix can deliver better value to more members through new ad-supported offerings.

This is an opportunity to lead innovative research with demonstrable impact on a global scale. You will be responsible for defining, leading, analyzing, and socializing research studies that generate insights to empower business decisions across the company. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams passionate about delivering the most engaging, innovative, and inclusive experiences.


In This Role, You Will


Identify, prioritize, and lead research roadmaps that generate insights to inform monetization strategies across the company.Partner with cross-functional teams, including Product, Ads, Product Marketing, Design, Data Science, Strategy Planning & Analysis, and Brand to proactively develop research initiatives.Define, design, execute, and socialize a range of research studies that build a strong understanding of existing and future audiences and their experiences worldwide.Identify best practices in existing and emerging research methodologies.



About You


Demonstrable experience in product research and/or user experience (UX) research informing growth and monetization strategy. Experience supporting subscription businesses or ad-supported online products preferred.Mixed methods research expertise including hands-on experience leading end-to-end quantitative and qualitative research studiesA balance of creative and analytical skills with the ability to proactively define research questions, identify appropriate methods, execute studies, and synthesize findings.Strong communicator with a bias toward action to proactively collaborate with multiple teams across the company.Passionate about translating findings into actionable strategic business recommendationsGlobal research experience is highly preferred but not required.

Title: Technical Operations & Insights Analyst, Product Support
Description:
Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, design and build better products — from start to finish. Whether it’s consolidating tools, simplifying workflows, or collaborating across teams and time zones, Figma makes the design process faster, more efficient, and fun while keeping everyone on the same page. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!

As a member of our Product Support Operations and Strategy team, the Operations and Insights Analyst will use data to refine our Product Support experience, build dashboards and data pipelines, and deliver reporting to ensure our leadership team has a clear pulse on the business. You’ll identify opportunities to optimize Figma’s product support operations. As a problem solver, you will dig into data to find root causes, identify trends, uncover blind spots, and help to answer questions about the customer and employee experience. YoYou will present data to the team in a manner that is effective, tangible, and tells a clear story.

This is a full time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.

What you’ll do at Figma:

Build data pipelines that enable reliable, accurate, and timely data insightsEnable product support to capture customer, product, and team performance insightsDevelop and maintain workforce capacity models to forecast staffing needsDesign scalable data pipelines, and communicate design recommendations to leadership and our internal partnersCollaborate with our data science and engineering teams to build, document, and manage our Product Support data structure and pipelines.

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

Proficiency in SQL and querying databases using tools like Tableau, Mode, Looker, or Zendesk Explore (we use Mode, Explore, and Hex)A deep understanding of statistical analysis and data modeling techniquesExperience building complex ETL jobsProven track record of presenting technical findings to non-technical stakeholdersExperience problem-solving through issues that impact the customer and product support teams

While not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:

Experience supporting a technical SaaS company in a senior analyst capacityExperience developing in DBTProficiency in R and/or PythonApplied ML experience

At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Pay Transparency Disclosure

If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.

Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.

Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental & vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave & reproductive or family planning support, mental health & wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning & development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement. Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future. You may view our Pay Transparency Policy by clicking on the corresponding link.

$102,000—$215,000 USD

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
At January, we work to ensure that borrowers who fall behind on debt are treated with fairness and respect. Owing to outdated processes and bad actors, traditional debt collection is rife with harassment and fraud. Our products tackle this by helping financial institutions modernize collections, giving borrowers simpler and more compassionate ways to get back on track.

About The Role

As a Senior Product Analyst, you'll play a significant role in shaping product direction through data analysis, visualization, modeling and experimentation. Working closely with product managers, your actionable insights will directly affect how our users get out of debt and back to financial stability.

Your Impact

As a dedicated resource for the Client Activation product team, you’ll combine strategic thinking with data driven insights to help our clients understand and intelligently modify custom collection strategies for their borrowers. Part of this role will involve the development of machine learning models.

Additionally, as a member of the analytics team you will support other product and operations teams by providing easy access to data insights, supporting experimentation design and analysis, and making impactful recommendations to improve our product and processes.

You May Be a Fit If You

Have at least 2 years experience using SQLHave used languages like Python or R to conducting statistical analysis and build and evaluate models Have a medium to advanced understanding of statistics as they relate to experimentation and model developmentAre able to present data in a compelling way to empower our product and engineering teams to make better decisions.Are able to work independently: given context and some initial guidance, you’re able to do a deep dive and make insightful recommendations for the business.

January believes in doing its part to help close the wage gap that continues to plague much of the US workforce. We offer transparent and equitable compensation packages to all existing and future January team members.

Our compensation range for the Senior Product Analyst role is $125,000 to $176,000. We determine the final package by considering experience, applicable education and training, and relevant skills derived throughout our interview process. This role also includes a competitive equity package, giving you a chance to feel true ownership of your work.

January prioritizes the safety and well-being of our team members and, as such, requires all employees who work from or visit a January office to have proof of COVID-19 vaccination or provide a valid medical or religious exemption.

What We Can Offer You

Pet-friendly office (only in NYC, for now!)Competitive equity packages, giving you a chance to feel true ownership of your workUnlimited PTO so you can take the time you need to rest and rechargeHybrid work model, where our team comes in 3x a weekFlexible work hours for better work/life balance12 weeks fully paid new parent leave program for all employees to enjoy bonding timeFree lunches for team socializing activitiesAnnual learning and development budget to invest in your professional growth401k so you can invest in your futureGym membership reimbursementMedical, dental, and vision insuranceFree access to One Medical Free access to the mental well-being platform Spring Health plus 3 free virtual sessions with a Spring Health licensed therapistCommuter benefits for your travel to/from the officeEndless growth opportunity and the ability to take on new and exciting challenges

Title: User Risk Strategist
Description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

As Stripe continues to develop innovative products that serve businesses of all sizes around the world, risk will increase in complexity and scale. The User Risk Strategy protects and advances Stripe’s business, brand, and mission by building and deploying industry-leading policies and practices that instill user and partner trust in Stripe while enabling business growth.

What you’ll do

As a member of the User Risk Strategy team, you will partner with cross-functional teams—including Risk, Product, Partnerships, Legal, Sales, and Data Science—to design and execute on strategies and projects to improve Stripe’s risk controls and user experience. You will provide expert guidance and analyses to the business and to our most strategic customers to enable Stripe to grow in a risk-conscious manner.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about navigating ambiguity, enabling business growth while balancing risk, and is skilled at identifying ways to improve user experience.

Responsibilities

Drive risk strategy for company-level strategic initiatives, including partnering with Stripe’s product, legal, operations, sales, and partnerships teams to solve risk problems and ensure a positive experience for Stripe’s usersPerform research and analysis to assess Stripe’s current risk performance and develop and prioritize long-term strategic plans for future growthEnable user onboarding to safely grow at scale, continuously optimizing for efficiency and effectiveness, and staying hyper focused on a positive user experienceChallenge the status quo and provide multiple alternative solutions and key execution criteriaRepresent Stripe in external engagements with our most critical partners and customersExecute special projects/ad hoc analyses as initiatives, products, risks, and opportunities are constantly evolving


Who you are

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

5+ years of professional experience, preferably in Financial Services, Payments or fintech industriesExperience in a related role (risk, compliance and/or product enablement)Experience in developing risk strategies and solutions and working with technical (product and engineering) and operations teams to implement themAbility to distill complex, ambiguous risk and policy problems into clear, concise, and reliable guidance for internal stakeholders and Stripe usersStrong stakeholder management skills, including experience influencing product/engineering, sales, data science, and operations teamsDemonstrated track record of deriving insights from complex or technical problem spaces and evangelizing actionable product recommendationsThe ability to take ownership, be accountable, and drive towards ambitious goalsEntrepreneurial and curious mindset, strong communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to operate independently, navigate ambiguity, and solve problems with the end user in mindStrong desire to work in a fast paced and innovative environment


Preferred Qualifications

 Proficiency in one of the following:Card network rules and regulations KYC/KYB, AML OFAC compliance Experience overseeing execution and delivery of highly-strategic programs; proven ability to take complex issues and turn them into actionable next steps, hold others accountable, and meet deadlinesExperience with data querying languages (e.g., SQL) and proficiency in quantitative analysis geared towards drawing actionable insights from complex datasetsAdvanced degree in law, business, policy or other related fieldExperience in translating business requirements to technical configurations

Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $91,600 - $177,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Analytics Enablement
Description:
POS-23305

Staff Analysts are responsible for setting the standard for how data and analytics are performed and consumed within Operations and across HubSpot. This is an individual contributor leadership role, intended to reflect individuals who have the demonstrated capability of taking cross-functional, complex, and mission-critical projects and delivering success.

HubSpot’s Operations team is the beating heart of the company - in addition to owning performance measurement, process improvement, strategy & planning across most functions, Ops is also home to 120+ analysts. We are building a new team to drive analytics excellence across Ops, and looking for a veteran analyst with a passion for teaching and team enablement to work directly with the Sr Director of Analytics to shape this vision. As HubSpot scales its data and analytics capabilities, it’s become critical to spotlight best practices from across the org, and follow through with support and enablement so they are actually adopted by other analysts. With a large and diverse population of analysts, this is critical to ensuring more time is spent generating insights, with less time lost due to the wrong tool for the job.

As Staff Analyst, Analytics Enablement you will work across the organization to identify these best practices, and get them rolled out. You’ll partner with ops teams supporting almost every HubSpot function, and build an analyst enablement program that supports a scaled, globally distributed team.

General Responsibilities

Work with managers of analysts to deeply understand what their teams do, where they excel, and where there may be opportunities for improvement with the introduction of new skills, techniques or toolsConstruct training and onboarding programs for technical skill development (eg querying Snowflake with SQL; data manipulation in Python; basics of LookML); this could mean building curriculum yourself, identifying industry certification programs or curating online courses, or getting other analysts to contributeWork with recruiting to ensure analytics hiring processes are screening for the right skillsDrive analyst-led ceremonies for knowledge sharing, peer mentorship, code review, etcSupport managers of analysts in calibrating on technical skill evaluation to ensure we’re setting a consistent performance standard across the organizationWork with the Sr Director of Analytics to shape a sustainable program including future resourcing and responsibilities

Minimum Qualifications

Academic or professional experience with a heavy quantitative, analytical focusMasters or PhD in quantitative field not required, but a great indicator ~5 years minimum professional experience for most candidatesTrack record of driving organization-wide impact in a business environment, influencing decision-making with data; ideally working with cross-functional, executive (C-level) stakeholdersExperience with enterprise-scale analytics architectures built for a variety of applications (beyond SQL transformations/reporting)Ability to write performant, complex SQL queries combining multiple sources of dataExpertise with data analytics and statistical tools such as R or PythonConfidence with a variety of analytical and statistical techniques; expertise with a subsetExcellent communication, storytelling, and collaboration skillsDemonstrated passion for teaching, mentoring, or developing teams - particularly without direct management
Cash compensation range: 160,000 - 190,000 USD Annually

This resource will help guide how we recommend thinking about the range you see. Learn more about HubSpot’s compensation philosophy from Katie Burke, HubSpot’s Chief People Officer.

The cash compensation above includes base salary, on-target commission for employees in eligible roles, and annual bonus targets under HubSpot’s bonus plan for eligible roles. In addition to cash compensation, some roles are eligible to participate in HubSpot’s equity plan to receive restricted stock units (RSUs). Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay. Individual compensation packages are based on a few different factors unique to each candidate, including their skills, experience, qualifications and other job-related reasons.

We know that benefits are also an important piece of your total compensation package. To learn more about what’s included in total compensation, check out some of the benefits and perks HubSpot offers to help employees grow better.

At HubSpot, fair compensation practices isn’t just about checking off the box for legal compliance. It’s about living out our value of transparency with our employees, candidates, and community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

Title: Risk User Experience Strategist
Description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

The Risk User Experience and Insights team enables good users to thrive on Stripe by creating an intuitive and tailored risk experience that effectively mitigates compliance, financial and reputational risk. The team conducts qualitative and quantitative research, develops product strategies that alleviate risk pain points, and drives execution with partners across Engineering, Product, Design and Operations. Ultimately, the team ensures that a good user is never surprised by Stripe’s risk actions and has straightforward recourse with minimal impact to their business.

What you’ll do

We are looking for an experienced risk management professional to join the team and help provide a stellar risk experience for Stripe users. You will leverage data analytics, user research, and qualitative analyses to identify opportunities, craft innovative product solutions, and execute on those solutions in partnership with engineering, design and operations teams without compromising on risk mitigation.

Responsibilities

Define Stripe’s risk user experience strategy and convert it into a product roadmapIdentify and quantify user pain points through rigorous data analysisLaunch both qualitative and quantitative experiments and research studies to understand user expectations and friction areasCreate innovative product-driven solutions to effectively improve the risk user experienceDevelop relationships with key partners across product, engineering, data science and business teamsCarefully balance risk mitigation, user experience and growth considerations in the product development process


Who you are

We are looking for someone who can define and lead large-scale projects targeted at improving the end-to-end risk user experience. These projects will be focused on improving Stripe’s products so that risk management is seamless for good users. The person will work independently in the highly cross-functional Risk org with engineering, data science, operations, design, and research.

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

4+ years professional experience in a related field, such as Risk, Compliance, or Trust & Safety, within a fast-paced, high-growth companyProfessional experience with data querying languages (e.g., SQL) and proficiency in quantitative analysis geared towards drawing actionable insights from complex datasetsDemonstrated track record of deriving insights from complex problem spaces and leveraging data to drive decisions, set goals, and evaluate impact.Experience communicating to all levels of management, including strong writing skills and experience writing strategy documents, one-page project updates, and/or whitepapersStrong stakeholder management skills, including experience influencing multi-disciplinary product teams including engineers, designers, product managers and data scientistsDemonstrated program management skills and a track record for building and scaling programs from the ground upAbility to operate independently and navigate ambiguityStrong desire to work in a fast-paced and innovative environment


Preferred Qualifications

Experience working in the payments or tech industriesExperience with Python or other programming languagesPMP certification and/or Six Sigma certification


Working remotely at Stripe

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $105,300 - $177,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Description:
Business Unit:

Industry:

Houlihan Lokey – Lead Product Analyst

Overview

Houlihan Lokey (NYSE:HLI) is a global investment bank with expertise in mergers and acquisitions, capital markets, financial restructuring, and valuation. The firm serves corporations, institutions, and governments worldwide with offices in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, and the Asia-Pacific region. Independent advice and intellectual rigor are hallmarks of the firm’s commitment to client success across its advisory services. Houlihan Lokey is the No. 1 investment bank for all global mergers and acquisitions (M&A) transactions, the No. 1 M&A advisor for the past seven consecutive years in the U.S., the No. 1 global restructuring advisor for the past eight consecutive years, and the No. 1 global M&A fairness opinion advisor for the past 20 years, all based on number of transactions and according to data provided by Refinitiv. For more information, please visit www.hl.com.

General Description:

The Lead Product Analyst will be responsible for product strategy, concept development, and defining initiatives in collaboration with our key stakeholders and partners in the Portfolio Valuation practice, a service line within Financial and Valuation Advisory. The person in this role will understand business and technical capabilities in the key products and enable product roadmaps for delivering new capabilities.

The ideal candidate will be highly collaborative, able to work effectively in a matrixed organization while performing multiple roles or functions, be comfortable working autonomously, and be adept at synthesizing a variety of technologies and capabilities into high quality products and applications. The role will be a liaison to software engineering teams as well as support projects, enhancements, and managing the backlog and prioritization of features and capabilities.

Responsibilities: 

Develop and maintain relationships with business, vendor, and technology stakeholders. Manage product roadmap in terms of prioritizing initiatives relative to business needs. Combine business requirements into prioritized backlog items that are then grouped into sprints & releases. Lead complex analysis, providing guidance and oversight. Facilitate and create user stories to enable system modification or development. Identify product and process improvement opportunities by staying involved in product sustainment and addressing customer feedback. Escalate issues and recommend appropriate solutions. Support the business in business, technical, and financial feasibility assessments. Collaborate with the business to assess third party products and vendor capabilities. Manage partner expectations, scope, and budget discussions. Manage the scope and traceability of requirements throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring that they are understood by the project team and met by the delivered solution. Collaborate with business partners to conduct User Acceptance testing. 

Required Qualifications:

4+ years of product management experience Understanding of Agile practices Motivated, detail-oriented, and passionate about solving problems. Ability to think strategically and drive ideas into action, with a positive outlook and willingness to take personal initiative. Demonstrated ability to identify, understand, and drive resolution of complex critical issues. Excellent analytical, written, and verbal communication skills. Ability to collaborate with colleagues and be a team player. Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to communicate effectively and confidently at all levels. Previous experience with JIRA, Service Now, Github, or similar tools Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Finance, Business Administration, or similar field, or equivalent work experience 

Preferred Requirements:

Industry experience in Investment Banking / Finance. 

Salary Range

Houlihan Lokey is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive total compensation package, which may include other components such as discretionary incentive compensation. The firm’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the possible salary range for this role at the time of posting is:

$180,000.00-$200,000.00

Actual salary at the time of hire may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant qualifications, skills, and experience and the location where this position may be filled.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Provide input into the company software roadmap as an expert in customers' work processes and goals. If you're driven by the passion to do something meaningful that changes lives, Nestlé is the place for you. Because our focus is not only on nourishing our customers, but also about enriching you.

The Product Information (PI) Team sits within Nestle USA’s Digital and eCommerce team, and is responsible for managing data in our PIM, DAM, and external connecting platforms to ensure product information efficacy, speed and efficiency for Nestle USA.

The Product Information Analyst ensures the accuracy of existing product information; coordinates implementation of new customers and products; ensures product data conforms with industry standards and internal procedures. This role collaborates with Brand and Marketing teams, Sales teams, Master Data teams and external Application Service Providers and Customers to define and refine industry standards and business processes.

 Support new and existing Global Data Sync customers: Drive product information excellence across our people and technologyEnsure new data conforms with industry standards and internal procedures Trouble-shoot, conduct analysis and address errors in new and existing product information Execute training and support to Account teams on tech systems & processes and new item process Perform and deliver data analyses to proactively monitor syndicated data quality Provide QA reporting on completeness and accuracy of product informationContribute to evolution of our ways of working, continual driving for stronger and smarter approaches Elevate the relationship between the Product Information Team and stakeholders: Influence stakeholders to understand how product information works and why it’s critical to NUSA successAnticipate customer and stakeholder needs by understanding their deliverables and responsibilitiesEducate stakeholders to understand processes, ways of working, technologyDeliver above average to excellent customer satisfaction Drive toward new solutions that improve our efficiencies and effectiveness Deliver projects to support department and organizational initiatives:Deliver day-to-day while balancing timelines Balance timelines with importance of providing quality deliverables Manage stakeholder expectations Understand and mitigate risk

MINIMUM REQIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 

Education: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business Administration.2-4 years of experience in Marketing, Packaging, Supply Chain, Master Data, Data Governance, or systems analysis. Strong working knowledge of Consumer Packaged Goods industry and the Global Data Synchronization Network. Experience working in the following systems and software: Source systems such as, ERP systems (preferably SAP). PIM and DAM systems (preferably Salsify). Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Office applications; advanced knowledge and experience with Excel is required. Required skillset: Excellent communication skills with an ability to address audiences of all levels and varying technical knowledge. Ability to manage multiple tasks and changing priorities while taking full accountability for quality efforts and deliverables. Detail-orientated with a strong analytical and decision-making skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment. Strong customer focus. Strong technical skillset and an ability to trouble-shoot issues as well as identify root cause.
